sub_topic: Prove that the symmetric difference of two sets is not commutative with respect to intersection.
message_1: Let set A = {2, 4, 6, 8, 10} and set B = {1, 3, 5, 7, 9}. Find the symmetric difference of A and B, then find the intersection of A and B. Finally, show that the symmetric difference of A and B is not commutative with respect to intersection, i.e., show that (A Δ B) ∩ B ≠ (B Δ A) ∩ A.
